voyages.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt Diplomatic Cruise
voyages.summary_markdown:
## Diplomatic Meeting

President Franklin D. Roosevelt hosted a state reception aboard the USS Sequoia. The voyage included discussions on foreign policy and national security matters.

The menu included prime rib, lobster tail, and fine wines from the presidential cellar.Captain Anderson expertly navigated the vessel through challenging conditions.The crew provided exceptional service throughout the voyage.
voyages.source_urls: National Archives, Presidential Papers, Franklin D. Roosevelt Library
notes: Sample voyage #1 for Franklin D. Roosevelt
Generated to demonstrate all database fields and website functionality
This voyage showcases: photos, royalty
voyages.additional_information: This voyage is notable for including members of the royal family. Representatives from the Recreation and Morale Division were present.
voyages.additional_sources: See also: Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library Archives, Daily Diary entries for 1944-07-07

voyages.summary_markdown:
## Ceremonial Voyage

President Franklin D. Roosevelt hosted an official business meeting aboard the USS Sequoia. The voyage featured ceremonial activities and photo opportunities.

The menu included prime rib, lobster tail, and fine wines from the presidential cellar.The yacht spun in the Potomac River for optimal views.Captain Anderson expertly navigated the vessel through challenging conditions.The crew provided exceptional service throughout the voyage.
